column4: A 40 MB utility partition, and a 200GB ntfs partition (bootable).  The 200 GB ntfs partition is 1/4 full with windows junk...can I just resize it with the partitioner on the ubuntu cd
ok say i want 10 gig for ubuntu...how do I set it up without killing current windows...that is what scares me.
DO BACKUPS! Then grap partitionmagic (that is better at resizing ntfs then the free tools).
It should be possible... it should work... I wouldn't do it (without lots of backups).
